Articles.Content:
Hello all,

I am kind of stuck. Just downloaded the 1.0 version of KSP and installed it next to the beta version.

The beta launcher (still) starts fine, the 1.0 launcher doesn't start.

The exact error is "Unable to load mono library from /home/user/Games/KSP\_linux/Launcher\_Data/Mono (x86\_64)"

I tried updating the mono library, it is up to date.

System is a fresh install with current NVIDIA drivers.

Any ideas?

(BTW, the game starts, it is the launcher which has the issues)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-10T08:15:38Z" title="05/10/2015 08:15  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 10, 2015</time> by Snarfster**
  
Solved in 1.0.2

Hmm, KSP uses the Mono library built into Unity, not the one from the repos so updating that won't do a lot here, do you have both the x86 and x86\_64 launchers or just one? Also please provide your system info.

Al right, I just checked the 32 bit launcher, that starts up fine. (For 0.90, both work)

Systemspecs:

OS: Linux 3.13 LinuxMint 17.1 64bit

CPU: Intel® Core i7-2600K CPU @ 3.40GHz (8)

RAM: 16025

GPU: GeForce GTX 980/PCIe/SSE2 (4096MB)

SM: 30 (OpenGL 4.5 [4.5.0 NVIDIA 346.59])

RT Formats: ARGB32, Depth, ARGBHalf, RGB565, ARGB4444, ARGB1555, Default, DefaultHDR, ARGBFloat, RGFloat, RGHalf, RFloat, RHalf, R8

Just tried all versions of .90, they run fine. It is only the 64 bit launcher that is included with 1.0 that seems to be the issue.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-29T20:50:48Z" title="04/29/2015 08:50  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 29, 2015</time> by Snarfster**
Do you have a "KSP\_linux/Launcher\_Data/Mono (x86\_64)" folder? I notice that mines missing.
No, I seem to be missing that one.
Hmm I would not be surprised if Squad ditched the x86\_64 launcher, but if the regular one works I'd not worry too much.
Just curious which version of KSP the regular launcher will launch ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Most likely the x86 version but you can just click the x86\_64 anyway ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

So what does the launcher do for you?

Why bother including it if it's broken?
It wasn't broken in 0.90. Something went missing in 1.00.

I'm running into this on Linux as well. The x86 launcher runs, but not the x86\_64 launcher.

Out of curiosity, does the "update" feature work for you with the x86 launcher? I'm not having any luck with that.
This is fixed in 1.0.2. (I had the same problem, but the KSP.x86 and KSP.x86\_64 executables work fine if you just run them directly.)
Confirmed, the 64 bit launchers works again with 1.0.2
I have the same problem but its KSP itself that's not launching.

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, Firefox101 said:
> 
> 
> I have the same problem but its KSP itself that's not launching.
> 

Hi. Given this report is for an old version of KSP and its no-longer-supported launcher, you might want to post this as a new thread. Don't forget to include a link to your output.log file [and any other relevant information](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/83213-stock-support-bug-reporting-guide/).
